channel.title: Ternary operator

item.title: Ternary operator
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

eyeownyew:

Just for reference, you can remove the parentheses around c.playerRights >= 3

I used it to make the code clearer. If the (if) statement gets more complicated, you don’t want everything to be a mess. This is of course just personal preference. Just make sure you don’t trade away readability for “fanciness”.

Read full topic

item.title: Ternary operator
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

ternary ternaries are cooler

(c.playerRights == 0 ? “YOU CANT NOCLIP” : c.playerRights != 1 ? “NOCLIP IS ON.” : “MODERATORS CANT NOCLIP.”)

Read full topic

Not as complicated as everyone is making it seem[/quote]
Making a tutorial as we speak.

item.title: Ternary operator
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“ravekitty, post:3, topic:531132”][quote author=Strucker link=topic=649896.msg4365250#msg4365250 date=1379533968]
I’d like to see a ternary operator in server tutorials tbh
[/quote]

I would too, I’ve read about them many times and still have no idea how to set one up.[/quote]
I would, but I just can’t explain the process. I mean, I can do them, but, explaining it is so hard to do.

I mean, for example:

	if (playerCommand.startsWith("noclip"))
		c.sendMessage(c.playerRights >= 3 ? "Noclip is now on!" : "You can't use this command");

I did that in a minute, I just can’t explain the process.

Read full topic

item.title: Ternary operator
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Just for reference, you can remove the parentheses around c.playerRights >= 3

boolean print = true; System.out.println("" + (print ? "Printing in the future!" : "Not printing in the future."));

Read full topic

item.title: Ternary operator
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

if(playerCommand.startsWith("noclip")
c.sendMessage((c.playerRights >=3) ? "Noclip is now on!" : "You can't use this command");

This should work iirc.
Here is a full tutorial:

en.wikipedia.org

?:

In computer programming, ?: is a ternary operator that is part of the syntax for basic conditional expressions in several programming languages. It is commonly referred to as the conditional operator, inline if (iif), or ternary if. An expression a ? b : c evaluates to b if the value of a is true, and otherwise to c. It originally comes from CPL, in which equivalent syntax for e1 ? e2 : e3 was e1 → e2, e3. Although many ternary operators are possible, the conditional operator is so common, and ot...

Read full topic

item.title: Ternary operator
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

Is it possible to convert this into a ternary statement

if (playerCommand.startsWith("noclip")){ if (c.playerRights >=3) { c.sendMessage("Noclip is now on!"); } else { c.sendMessage("You can't use this command"); } }

Read full topic
